#### Structure

- Perovskite is <span style= "color:Blue"> Calcium Titanate $(CaTiO_3)$ </span>

    - Discovered in 1839 by Gustav Rose in Ural mountains and named after mineralogist Count Lev Perovski.
    - The structure was first described by  <span style="color:Green"> Victor Goldschmidt in 1926 </span>


<div style="color:FireBrick; text-align:center">

Perovskites generally exist in the form $ABX_3$.

</div>

#### Properties
- Flexible structure
- Tunable bandgap
- High absorption coefficient
- High dielectric constant
- Low exciton binding energy
- Good thermoelectric properties
- Ferroelectric properties

<div style="color:FireBrick; text-align:center">

Undesirable phase transitions at room temperature affecting their stability

</div>


#### Technical Background

- Crystal
- Periodicity - translational symmetry
- Bloch Theorem
Eigenstates of periodic Hamiltonian can be written as:
$$
\psi_{n,k}(r) = e^{\iota k.r} u_{n,k}(r)
$${#eq-Bloch'stheorem}

<div style="color:FireBrick; text-align:center">

Delocalized orbitals- not appropriate for visualziation of chemcial bonds

</div>

<div style="color:FireBrick; text-align:center">

Scales cubically with system's size due to the dependance of k values

</div>
